lol thats funny
  the other night i was recording in my room the first time while i was asleep using a tape voice recorder, and i had the tv on to a hispanic music channel, but got nothing ont he evp lol
   
  awsome info ty
   
  amy

Jody Cupp <bigrig309@...> wrote:
            Amy,
  Have you tried using music (not vocals) playing softly in the background when you record?  I'm hearing "use music" at the begining when I did a light noise reduction.  Music really helped me as I was getting my feet off the ground.  It recharges you, the room and even helps them form their voice. You'll want to play something soothing and relaxing to you.  This could be anything from a guitar solo, classical or any meditation type music.  What ever makes you feel good is what you should use. :)
    ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Amy Swanson 
  To: evp-itc@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Saturday, July 08, 2006 11:41 PM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] evp bit
  

      Frank or anyone available?
  Can you clean this up? When i clean it up i can hear something, but not getting it to where i want it! The background noise is A. me breathing B. A pair of jeans clanging in the dryer! lol
   
   
  amy
